text: [Ethan] There's been a lot of talk, uh...from other YouTubers lately,
about there being some kind of glitch,
that's been fucking with channels' views,
which is really weird, 'cause we were thinking the same thing.
Now I know this is gonna sound a little conspiracy theory-ish, a little bit strange,
but YouTube has been really fucking around, I think with the algorithm,
in a really bizarre way that's made us a little spooked out.
And I want to, kind of, tell you guys what we think is happening,
and what you guys can do to prevent your favorite YouTube channel from completely and suddenly just disappearing out of your life.
You know, the obvious commenters, like, "oh, your videos just suck", "people just don't care about your videos",
I kinda...like, I get that,
but I want to prove to you, show you as well as I can, that that's not what's happening here,
and that there is something in the system that's just not showing you our videos.
Now, what's been happening to us? We noticed it happening last week and the week before, suddenly,
it would happen about once a week,
where our new upload wouldn't show up on the homepage,
it wouldn't show up on the mobile phone, it wouldn't show up on the TV, it wouldn't show up on the "Recommended" bar...
It was almost just completely disappeared and the only people that had access to it were people coming directly from the subscriber feed.
Now, I know-- the way I browse YouTube personally:
I never use my subscription feed. I always just seek on the recommended,
on the sidebar, and that's usually how I get my new videos, so when we noticed all of a sudden, like once per week,
our videos weren't popping up anywhere, almost like,
it seemed like a bug, it just wasn't in the system,
[Ethan Klein Inhalation™]
and the correlation was there too, where the video would get, like, half the views.
So, we posted a video yesterday,
that everybody's been enjoying, it's getting a lot of likes, it's even on the front page of Reddit.
OK? Now, if you go here, immediately we check, and it's nowhere.
So, you go on the homepage. This isn't...I'm not logged in as h3, OK?
So...this is Hila's account,
and she watches h3 videos on this account more than anyone,
so you'd think that it would be covered in it, because it's the most relevant YouTube channel.
So, if you go to "Recommended", there's nothing.
If you go to "Watch It Again", this is the weird part.
It doesn't show up. Here is a video from one month ago, before it was broken.

[Ethan voice-over] As I'm editing this video, I just noticed that they're recommending me watch "ISIS DUBSTEP REMIX".
[ISIS Dubstep Remix fades in]

[ISIS Dubstep Remix fades in]
That's some good content, dude, that's definitely what I wanna watch, and not some fucking new video from a channel that I watch religiously.
[Ethan] So, if you open the YouTube app, which is how I always watch new videos when people upload them...
And this is Hila's account so this is the biggest h3 fan in the world, essentially,
because we watch h3 all the time, it should be the most relevant.
Doesn't show up anywhere on the home feed.
Anywhere.
OK, now on the television. This is the other way I watch videos. I open the YouTube app,
again, this is our account. "Recommended", "Recently Uploaded", there's nothing here. Our videos used to be here all the time.
Every time.
And...there's nothing. It's all this irrelevant shit.
But here's the thing. It's not just us, like...I watch PewDiePie as much as any other YouTuber a lot,
and where's PewDiePie's videos? Because his videos used to show up for me every single time,
I open the app, or the TV, or the browser, because he's a channel that I used to always watch.
And now, if you look at his channel, his views are all fucked up
and the poor guy made, like, an apology video because he thinks his fans hate him and all abandoned him,
even though I think it's fucking YouTube's fault!
So, just as a little scientific experiment,
we did a poll on Twitter. We said, "Do you see our new video on your homepage?".
54% said no!
That majority of people, of our "super-fans", actually aren't seeing our...our videos on their...on their homepage.
But that's really troubling to me! 54%!
Now here's the stats from...two or plus weeks ago,
on a non-bugged video.
This was the interview with Hugh Mungus,
and you can see here that the suggested videos, that's the sidebar, is almost equal in views to the Browse feature,
which means people coming from their sub feed, versus people who catch it on the sidebar.
Now, if you look at the stats on one of our new fucked up videos, you'll see
the Browse feature is 600,000,
the suggested videos is 17,000...2.3%!
So, something's going on!
YouTube is definitely not showing the videos. The proof is here.
Now, the scary thing about this, is that it kind of reminds me about what happened to animators.
Like, two years ago, I don't know if you guys remember, but animation about two years ago used to be really popular on YouTube,
and one day YouTube just tweaked the algorithm to favor longer videos and more frequent posts,
and they didn't tell anyone, and they all just kinda fucking died,
and now there's no more animation channels left on YouTube, because they stopped getting shown,
they reduced their pay, and they pretty much, like I says, they just...disappeared from people's lives, kind of.
And that's what I'm kind of feeling now!
Like, it's just overnight, they fucking closed the faucet on some channels, and it's really spooky, because YouTube has that power, they have the ability
to say "you're fucked, and we want more of you", and it's not democratic at all, and I think that's really important to talk about it and be aware of it
before they fucking disappear our channel and we fade into fucking oblivion.
The people I've spoken to from Google and YouTube have been very gracious, very helpful, they're trying to figure it out, they've reached out to us, they're trying to understand it...
[Ethan Klein Inhalation™]
but there's definitely something, going on.
I mean...I'm not going to say anything...it did happen...
right after the Hugh Mungus episode, I'm not saying if that affected us one way or the not-- or not,
[sarcastic tone] I mean, I can't possibly know...
and it did affect other people, I'm just saying...
the timing is a little strange...
[back to serious tone] That being said, there is something you guys can do
to at least make sure that if you really want to support the YouTube channels you love,
that you'll always get the notification.
[Ethan voice-over] Once you're subscribed, you'll see the bell. Click that.
Turn on "Send me all notifications for this channel", and save.
[Ethan] And make sure to smash that bell for the channels you love.
Smash that shit like you're fucking...jerking off.
Like a bell, and I guess they say it in England, so...
smash that fff...
fucking bell button.

[Hila] That's why they're not gonna show your channel.
[Ethan] That's why they're not putting us up!
That's why we're not...I can't smash the bell!
I don't know, dude,
you expect me to stop smashing the bell, dude?
Is this how you masturbate?
This is how I masturbate.
Give it a try.
Practice on the bell, then go and...fucking smash the bell.
Thanks for watching, guys. See you next time.
Hopefully! If our fucking videos show up!
